data.enText: bound
bound
tie with rope/cloth
to tie sb/sth with rope, string, etc. so that they cannot move or are held together firmly
She was bound to a chair.

data.chText: 他们把他的双手绑在一起。
data.enText: They bound his hands together.

data.chText: 他被捆起来，用布封住嘴，扔在那儿了。
data.enText: He was left bound and gagged (= tied up and with a piece of cloth tied over his mouth) .
to tie a long thin piece of cloth around sth
She bound up his wounds.
unite
to unite people, organizations, etc. so that they live or work together more happily or effectively

data.chText: 诸如学校、俱乐部等机构使社区成为一个整体。
data.enText: Organizations such as schools and clubs bind a community together.

data.chText: 她以为生了他的孩子就会永远把他留住。
data.enText: She thought that having his child would bind him to her forever.
make sb do sth
to force sb to do sth by making them promise to do it or by making it their duty to do it
He had been bound to secrecy (= made to promise not to tell people about sth) .

data.chText: 根据协议，她必须在六个月内还清债务。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The agreement binds her to repay the debt within six months.
stick together
to stick together or to make things stick together in a solid mass

data.chText: 加个蛋黄使混合料凝结在一起。
data.enText: Add an egg yolk to make the mixture bind.

data.chText: 加个蛋黄使混合料凝结在一起。
data.enText: Add an egg yolk to bind the mixture together.
book
to fasten the pages of a book together and put them inside a cover
two volumes bound in leather
sew edge
to sew the edge of sth to decorate it or to make it stronger

data.chText: 那些毯子是用缎子包边的。
data.enText: The blankets were bound with satin.
bind/tie sb hand and foot
to tie sb's hands and feet together so that they cannot move or escape
to prevent sb from doing what they want by creating rules, restrictions, etc.
bind sb over
to give sb bail while they are waiting to go to trial
He was bound over for trial.

data.chText: 令某人具结保证（不再违法）
data.enText: to give sb a formal warning that if they break the law again they will be punished

data.chText: 她被责令具保一年内不再闹事。
data.enText: She was bound over to keep the peace for a year.
an annoying situation that is often difficult to avoid
in a bind
in a difficult situation that you do not know how to get out of

ex.enText: He tied his horse to a tree.

ex.chText: 把所有的信用一根丝带捆在一起。
ex.enText: Tie all your letters together with a ribbon.

ex.chText: 很多妻子觉得自己被家务束缚住了。
ex.enText: Many wives felt tied to housework.

synonyms.bx: 指用绳索等将人或东西绑住、拴牢，有时一端拴在固定的物体上，另一端仍可活动，常含受束缚、不自由之意。

ex.chText: 他们捆住了小孩的双手。

ex.enText: He designed a machine for binding up rice.

ex.chText: 婚姻把约翰和玛丽拴在了一起。
ex.enText: John and Mary are bound by marriage.

ex.chText: 共同的经历使这两个团体站在了一起。
ex.enText: Their shared experiences helped to bind the two communities together.

synonyms.bx: 指使用带子、绳索、镣铐等把两个或更多的东西牢牢地捆绑起来，使它们紧靠在一起或成为一体；也指以责任、义务、婚姻、血统、友谊等为纽带使人们形成新的相互依存关系。

ex.chText: 他们为什么把绳子绑在树上？
ex.enText: Why did they fasten the rope to a tree?

ex.chText: 请把这些文件整理一下，用夹子夹在一起。
ex.enText: Sort out these papers and fasten them together with a clip, please.

synonyms.bx: 指将一端或两端固定住，但另一端或两端中间仍可活动，使用之物除绳、带以外，还可以是夹子、螺钉、钩子等。

data.enText: bind/tie sb hand and foot
to tie sb's hands and feet together so that they cannot move or escape
to prevent sb from doing what they want by creating rules, restrictions, etc.
in a bind
in a difficult situation that you do not know how to get out of
bind sb over
to give sb bail while they are waiting to go to trial
He was bound over for trial.

data.chText: 令某人具结保证（不再违法）
data.enText: to give sb a formal warning that if they break the law again they will be punished

data.chText: 她被责令具保一年内不再闹事。
data.enText: She was bound over to keep the peace for a year.

tr: something that hinders as if with bonds

example: These foods tend to constipate you
I'll hold you by your promise

tr: fasten or secure with a rope, string, or cord
example: They tied their victim to the chair

tr: secure with or as if with ropes
example: tie up the old newspapers and bring them to the recycling shed

tr: tie or secure, with or as if with a rope
example: The Chinese would bind the feet of their women

tr: wrap around with something so as to cover or enclose

example: Will this wallpaper adhere to the wall?
The grandparents want to bond with the child

value.def: If something binds people together, it makes them feel as if they are all part of the same group or have something in common.

example.ex: It is the memory and threat of persecution that binds them together.
example.tran: 遭受迫害的记忆和威胁把他们紧紧联系在一起。

example.ex: ...the social and political ties that bind the USA to Britain.
example.tran: 将美国和英国紧紧相连的社会和政治纽带

example.ex: ...a group of people bound together by shared language, culture, and beliefs.
example.tran: 由共同的语言、文化和信仰紧紧联系在一起的一个群体

value.tran: 使紧密联系；使关系密切

value.def: If you are bound by something such as a rule, agreement, or restriction, you are forced or required to act in a certain way.

example.ex: The Luxembourg-based satellite service is not bound by the same strict rules as the BBC...
example.tran: 设在卢森堡的卫星服务公司无须像英国广播公司那样遵守严格的规定。

example.ex: The authorities will be legally bound to arrest any suspects...
example.tran: 当局负有逮捕所有疑犯的法律责任。

example.ex: There is a bottom deck though, so you're not bound to sit on top...
example.tran: 不过还有一个底舱，所以你不一定非得坐在顶层。

example.ex: The treaty binds them to respect their neighbour's independence.
example.tran: 条约规定他们必须尊重其邻国的独立。

value.tran: 约束；限制；使负有义务（或责任）

example.ex: The world of advertising is obviously less bound  by convention than the world of banking...
example.tran: 显然，广告业比银行业更少受到惯例的束缚。

example.ex: Few of them feel bound by any enduring loyalties.
example.tran: 他们中几乎没有人觉得有义务要保持忠诚。

value.def: If you bind something or someone, you tie rope, string, tape, or other material around them so that they are held firmly.

example.ex: Bind the ends of the cord together with thread.
example.tran: 用线把这根绳子的两端捆扎起来。

example.ex: ...the red tape which was used to bind the files...
example.tran: 用来捆扎文件的红带子

example.ex: He said there were cases where prisoners were tightly bound, often for several days.
example.tran: 他说有时犯人会被紧紧地捆绑起来，往往一捆就是好几天。

value.def: When a book is bound, the pages are joined together and the cover is put on.

example.ex: Each volume is bound in bright-coloured cloth...
example.tran: 每一卷都采用色彩亮丽的布面装帧。

example.ex: Their business came from a few big publishers, all of whose books they bound.
example.tran: 他们的业务来自于几个大出版商，这些出版商的书都是他们装订的。

example.ex: ...four immaculately bound hardbacks.
example.tran: 4本装订精美的精装书

example.ex: ...leather-bound stamp albums.
example.tran: 皮面集邮册

value.def: If one chemical or particle is bound to another, it becomes attached to it or reacts with it to form a single particle or substance.

example.ex: At present nobody understands why these three quarks which are in the proton are bound together...
example.tran: 目前还没有人知道质子里面的这三个夸克为什么会结合在一起。

example.ex: These may bind to receptor molecules on the surfaces of cells...
example.tran: 这些可能会在细胞表面和受体分子结合在一起。

example.ex: These compounds bind with genetic material in the liver.
example.tran: 这些化合物在肝脏中与遗传物质实现结合。

value.def: In cookery, if you bind a mixture of food, you form it into a mass by mixing it with a sticky substance.

example.ex: Bind the mixture with the raw minced liver and cook for 3 minutes more.
example.tran: 让混合物滚上切碎的生肝脏，烹饪3分钟以上。

example.ex: ...a divine mixture of vegetarian cheeses bound with egg.
example.tran: 素干酪和鸡蛋黏合在一起的绝妙搭配

value.def: If you are in a bind, you are in a difficult situation, usually because you have to make a decision or a choice and whatever decision or choice you make will have unpleasant consequences.

example.ex: This puts the politicians in a bind as to what course to take...
example.tran: 这使政治家们左右为难，不知道该如何处理。

example.ex: I'll advance you the money for it, here and now, just to help you out of a bind.
example.tran: 我现在就把钱预付给你，好让你摆脱困境。

value.tran: 左右为难的境地；进退两难的境地

value.def: If you say that something is a bind, you mean that it is unpleasant and boring to do.

example.ex: It is expensive to buy and a bind to carry home.
example.tran: 买这个费用很贵，搬回家也费劲。

value.tran: 令人不快的事物；无聊的事物
